content:
Diagnosis
	1. Left breast adenosquamous carcinoma, N0M0
	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Core biopsy left breast

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Newly diagnosed, awaiting definitive surgery

	Current issues
	None significant

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] is a 52-year-old lady who attended breast clinic today following detection of a left breast mass on screening mammogram. Core biopsy has confirmed a low-grade adenosquamous carcinoma. Staging investigations including CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis and bone scan show no evidence of metastatic disease. Biomarker testing shows ER positive (8/8), PR positive (7/8), and HER2 positive (3+). NTRK fusion testing is negative.

On examination today, there is a 2.2cm firm mass in the left breast at 2 o'clock position, 4cm from nipple. No skin changes or nipple retraction. No palpable axillary nodes. Right breast normal.

I have discussed the diagnosis and treatment options with [redacted name]. Given the tumor size and biomarker status, we recommend breast conserving surgery with sentinel lymph node biopsy, followed by adjuvant chemotherapy and targeted anti-HER2 therapy, then radiotherapy.

	Further investigations
	MRI breast for surgical planning

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Breast MDT discussion next week
Surgical consultation to be arranged within 2 weeks

	Required GP actions
	None

CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis and bone scan show no evidence of metastatic disease

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed left breast cancer. Initial staging complete with no metastatic disease identified.
Breast MDT discussion next week and surgical consultation within 2 weeks
Plan for breast conserving surgery with sentinel lymph node biopsy, followed by adjuvant chemotherapy and targeted anti-HER2 therapy, then radiotherapy
